subject: Business
title: Building Supply Chain Resilience
description: A quick, practical guide to Building Supply Chain Resilience.

hook.text: Toyota recovered from the 2011 tsunami in weeks. Other automakers took months. Resilience was designed in.

buildup.text: Resilience is the ability to anticipate, prepare for, respond to, and recover from disruptions.

discovery.text: Resilience strategies: dual sourcing, safety stock, flexible manufacturing, and supply chain visibility.

twist.text: Resilience costs money upfront. Companies only invest after a crisis â€” which is always too late.

climax.text: Companies that invested in resilience pre-COVID recovered revenue 7% faster than those that didn't.

punchline.text: Resilience is expensive until you need it. Then it's priceless.

quiz.question: Why do most companies underinvest in supply chain resilience?
options: Resilience costs money upfront and its value is only visible during crises
Resilient supply chains are always slower
Regulations prevent companies from building backup systems
